phys::xml::Attribute

phys::xml::Attribute Class Reference

This represents the attributes that could exist on an XML element. More...

Detailed Description

This represents the attributes that could exist on an XML element.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

phys::xml::Attribute::Attribute ( const String &  name,
const String &  value 
)

Construct an attribute with name and value.

Parameters:
name What the Attribute is called for example in " \<div style="14"\>Content\</div\> " the word "style" is the attribute name
value What the Attribute is called for example in " \<div style="14"\>Content\</div\> " the word "14" is the attribute value

Attribute * phys::xml::Attribute::Next ( bool  throwIfNoAttribute = true  )  const

Get the next sibling attribute in the DOM.

Warning:
This will cause memory leaks if the created pointer is not deleted
Parameters:
throwIfNo Attribute Should this function throw an exception if it fails, or silently fail. Defaults to true so it throws errors on failure.
Returns:
Returns a pointer to an XML::Attribute that comes after this one, but still on the same element
